Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Caerin 1.20 (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXA; UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: the skin secretions, hybrid between femaleLitoria splendidaandmale Litoria caerulea, Australia

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against B. cereus (MIC 100 ug/ml), E.faecalis (MIC>100 ug/ml), L. lactis (MIC 25 uM), L. innocua (MIC 25 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC 20 ug/ml, S. aureus ATCC 25923, or 29213 (MIC 25-50 ug/ml, S. epidermidis (MIC 25 ug/ml), S. uberis (MIC 50 ug/ml), E.clocae (MIC>100 ug/ml), E.coli (MIC>100 ug/ml), and P.multocida (MIC>100 ug/ml).Also, this peptide could inhibit HIV infection (VanCompernolle et al., 2015).Updated 6/2015; For add ref, see AP2008. 7/2021; 12/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Pukala TL, Bertozzi T, Donnellan SC, Bowie JH, Surinya-Johnson KH, Liu Y, Jackway RJ, Doyle JR, Llewellyn LE, Tyler MJ.2006, Australia
Literature Information.Title: Host-defence peptide profiles of the skin secretions of interspecific hybrid tree frogs and their parents, female Litoria splendida and male Litoria caerulea.
